feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued October 30 at 11:57PM AKDT until October 31 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 inches. Storm total snowfall since Saturday night of 8 to 18 inches, heaviest west of Tok. * WHERE...Along the Alaska Highway. * WHEN...Until 1 PM AKDT Monday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued October 30 at 9:27PM PDT until November 02 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...First Significant Storm of the Wet Season Early This Week... A strong storm system will move out of the Gulf of Alaska on Monday and move into the Pacific Northwest on Monday night. We are expecting a strong cold front to move across the region on Tuesday night. Snow is expected to increase during the day on Tuesday with the potential heavy snow on Tuesday night. The front
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kaiser to Rodgers Ridge; Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 30 at 8:41PM PDT until October 31 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM PDT MONDAY THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Increased risk of sneaker waves and strong rip currents along the coast, especially for northwest facing beaches. Larger breaking waves from 13 to 19 feet during the afternoon and evening hours.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 30 at 7:50PM PDT until October 31 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM PDT MONDAY THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Increased risk of sneaker waves, leading to larger and unexpected waves expected along the coast during the morning hours. Larger breaking waves from 15 to 21 feet during the afternoon and evening hours.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 30 at 8:35PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The forecast point at Astor remains in Moderate Flood Stage and has crested around 3.8 feet on Sunday due to recent north to northeast winds. River levels should resume a slow decline early this week while staying in Moderate Flood Stage.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 30 at 8:33PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The forecast point at Deland is forecast to remain in Moderate Flood Stage through this week while continuing a slow decline. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 30 at 8:32PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River at Sanford is forecast to remain in Moderate Flood Stage through next week while continuing a slow decline. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 30 at 8:31PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The St. Johns River above Lake Harney at Geneva is in Moderate Flood Stage and is forecast to continue a slow decline through Moderate Flood Stage into next week. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 31 at 12:17AM PDT until October 31 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .An atmospheric river will continue to bring heavy rainfall to the area through Monday morning. This is expected to push the Skokomish River above flood stage early this morning through most of Monday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Mason

entry.title: Flash Flood Watch issued October 30 at 10:34PM PDT until October 31 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Heavy rain is expected to continue over night into tomorrow morning. Around an inch and a half of rain has fallen since 600 AM in the vicinity of the Bolt Creek Fire, but hourly rainfall amounts so far have not been over a third of an inch. ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE BOLT CREEK BURN SCAR NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT MONDAY...
